oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Military pass issued by the Provost Marshal in Nashville to Mrs. Spencer for her carriage and driver
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; War -- Protection of civilians; Military police
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Military pass issued by the Provost Marshal's office to Mrs. Spencer for herself, her carriage, and driver through Federal lines to three miles out Lebanon Pike- good for 60 days. Signed by Captain H. H. Curling, Assistant Provost Marshal.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Provost Marshal's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Military provosts command the military police force of a designated area. Passes were issued to qualified individuals for travel and to prevent Federal guards and pickets from detaining them as hostile persons or spies.
